Package ar.edu.utn.frc.tup.lc.iv.services.impl

Class PeriodServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
ar.edu.utn.frc.tup.lc.iv.services.impl.PeriodServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
PeriodService
@Service public class PeriodServiceImpl extends Object implements PeriodService

* Implementation of the PeriodService that provides the current period * and the previous period based on a predefined day of the month (the 25th).

      Checks whether the expenses for the specified period are closed.
      Specified by:
      isCloseExpense in interface PeriodService
      Parameters:
      period - the period to check for closed expenses.
      Returns:

    • getByID

      public Period getByID(Long id)
      Retrieves a period by its ID. This method attempts to find a PeriodEntity by its ID. If found, it maps the entity to a Period object.
      Specified by:
      getByID in interface PeriodService
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the period to retrieve.
      Returns:
      the Period object if found.

    • getAllPeriods

      public List<PeriodResponseDtoFindAll> getAllPeriods()
      Retrieves a list of periods (max 2), sorted by end date. If no periods exist or the latest is closed, a new period is added. Converts periods to PeriodResponseDtoFindAll for response.
      Specified by:
      getAllPeriods in interface PeriodService
      Returns:
      A list of PeriodResponseDtoFindAll.

    • changeStatePeriod

      public void changeStatePeriod(Period period, ExpensesState state, Long idUser)
      Changes the state of a specified period.
      Specified by:
      changeStatePeriod in interface PeriodService
      Parameters:
      period - The Period.
      state - The new ExpensesState.
      idUser - the user id.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the liquidation associated with the period is closed and cannot be modified.

    • getAllPeriodActive

      public List<PeriodResponseDto> getAllPeriodActive()
      Retrieves a list of open periods (max 2), sorted by end date. If no open periods exist, a new open period is added. Converts periods to PeriodResponseDto for response.
      Specified by:
      getAllPeriodActive in interface PeriodService
      Returns:
      A list of PeriodResponseDto.

    • getAllPeriods

      public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Period> getAllPeriods(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable, Integer year, Integer month, String state)
      Retrieves a paginated list of periods from the database.
      Specified by:
      getAllPeriods in interface PeriodService
      Parameters:
      pageable - the pagination information, including the page number, page size, and sorting criteria.
      year - the year of the period
      month - the month of the period
      state - the expense state
      Returns:
      a Page containing Period DTOs, which represents the retrieved periods.

    • getAllPeriodActiveAsc

      public List<Period> getAllPeriodActiveAsc()
      Retrieves a list of open periods (max 2), sorted by end date. If no open periods exist, a new open period is added. Converts periods to PeriodResponseDto for response.
      Specified by:
      getAllPeriodActiveAsc in interface PeriodService
      Returns:
      A list of PeriodResponseDto.

    • getFuturePeriod

      public String getFuturePeriod()
      Retrieves the next period in "month/year" format based on the last recorded period.
      Specified by:
      getFuturePeriod in interface PeriodService
      Returns:
      A string representing the next period in "month/year" format.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.web.server.ResponseStatusException - if a period for the following month already exists, returning an HTTP 404 error.

    • updateEndDatePeriod

      public Boolean updateEndDatePeriod(Long periodId, PeriodBodyDto endDate, Long idUser)
      Updates the end date of an existing period. param periodId The ID of the period to be updated.
      Specified by:
      updateEndDatePeriod in interface PeriodService
      Parameters:
      endDate - The PeriodBodyDto containing the new end date.
      idUser - The ID of the user updating the period.
      periodId - The unique identifier of the period to be updated.
      Returns:
      true if the period was successfully updated.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - .
